DataElementConcept.preferredName: Pharmacogenomics Findings Domain Allele Chromosome Identifier
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A findings domain for gene expression and genetic variation assessments._Mutually exclusive alternative forms of the same gene occupying the same locus on homologous chromosomes, differing in nucleotide sequence and governing the same biochemical and developmental process._One of the bodies in the cell nucleus that is the bearer of genes, has the form of a delicate chromatin filament during interphase, contracts to form a compact cylinder segmented into two arms by the centromere during metaphase and anaphase stages of cell division, and is capable of reproducing its physical and chemical structure through successive cell divisions._One or more characters used to identify, name, or characterize the nature, properties, or contents of a thing.

Concepts.definition: A findings domain for gene expression and genetic variation assessments.

Property.preferredDefinition: Mutually exclusive alternative forms of the same gene occupying the same locus on homologous chromosomes, differing in nucleotide sequence and governing the same biochemical and developmental process.:One of the bodies in the cell nucleus that is the bearer of genes, has the form of a delicate chromatin filament during interphase, contracts to form a compact cylinder segmented into two arms by the centromere during metaphase and anaphase stages of cell division, and is capable of reproducing its physical and chemical structure through successive cell divisions.:One or more characters used to identify, name, or characterize the nature, properties, or contents of a thing.

Concepts.definition: Mutually exclusive alternative forms of the same gene occupying the same locus on homologous chromosomes, differing in nucleotide sequence and governing the same biochemical and developmental process.
A structure found in cells that is comprised of a strand of linearized double-stranded DNA plus proteins that package the DNA in a condensed coil form and regulate chromosomal function.
One or more characters used to identify, name, or characterize the nature, properties, or contents of a thing.
